result.execSummary:
The defendant Jessica L. Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fraudulent Writings/By Corp. Officer, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.39(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: FTE/schooling/combination of the two of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours community service per week.  Agent may accept that requirement if defendant is in treatment or as part of drug treatment court.
Absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

AODA.  Attend LEAP program and successfully complete.  Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department.  

DNA sample.

timeConds.notes: I&S to be used for rule violations

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jessica L. Smith

records.addlTxt: of Conviction and Order - ERP

Clerk Marisa. 
Case Called: 9:41 am 
INCLUDES 17CF772, 15CF174, AND 14CF910. 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty Andrew Morgan. 
VRCW. 

PLEA HEARING IN 17CF772. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. 
State moves to: 
Ct. 3 (Felony BJ)>>D&RI. 
Ct. 5 (Felony BJ)>>D&RI. 
Ct. 6 (Felony BJ)>>D&RI. 
Ct. 8 (Neglecting a Child)>>D&RI. 
Ct. 9 (Neglecting a Child)>>D&RI. 
Ct. 10 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: Ct. 1 (Possess with Intent - Amphetamine)>>NO CONTEST.
         : Ct. 2 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine)>>NO CONTEST. 
         : Ct. 4 (Felony BJ)>>NO CONTEST. 
         : Ct. 7 (Neglecting a Child)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

SENTENCING IN ALL 3 FILES. 
Parties have received PSI. No additions/corrections. 
COURT makes findings. 
COURT ORDERS: 
In 17CF772: Ct. 1>>8 years imprisonment - 4 years IC & 4 years ES - imposed and STAYED for 5 years probation - CONDITION: 6 months MCJ imposed & STAYED for rule violations. 
                    : Ct. 2>>6 years imprisonment - 3 years IC & 3 years ES - imposed and STAYED for 5 years probation - CONDITION: 6 months MCJ imposed & STAYED for rule violations. 
                    : Ct. 4>>6 years imprisonment - 3 years IC & 3 years ES - imposed and STAYED for 5 years probation - CONDITION: 6 months MCJ imposed & STAYED for rule violations. 
                    : Ct. 7>>9 months MCJ imposed and STAYED for 1 year probation - CONDITION: letter of apology to children. 
In 15CF174: Ct. 1>>6 years imprisonment - 3 years IC & 3 years ES - imposed and STAYED for 5 years probation - CONDITION: restitution to GT Independence as reflected in restitution order; 6 months MCJ imposed & STAYED for rule violations. 
In 14CF910: Ct. 1>>8 years imprisonment - 4 years IC & 4 years ES - imposed and STAYED for 5 years probation - CONDITION: 6 months MCJ imposed & STAYED for rule violations; $240 of buy money as part of CC. 
                    : Ct. 4>>9 months MCJ imposed and STAYED for 1 year probation - CONDITION: letter of apology to children. 

COURT ORDERS as CONDITIONS of Probation on ALL>>AODA; attend LEAP Program and successfully complete that; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; Drug treatment Court; absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization; fulltime employment/school/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours CS per week - agent my except that requirement if def is in treatment or as part of drug treatment court; DNA sample/surcharge; CC. 
COURT ORDERS all sentences to run CONCURRENT. 
COURT finds the def entitled to 235 days jail credit in 17CF772 and NO days jail credit in 15CF174 and 14CF910. 
COURT finds the def eligible for CIP and SAP. 

Adj: 10:07 am
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 19, 2018 at 09:30 am.
Waiting for acceptance into drug court
Calendar call on January 24, 2018 at 01:00 pm.
